subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: How to use Jerome font?
msgSnippet: I m afraid it doesn t work on a Mac, except perhaps if you use a Windows emulator - I don t know, I have no Mac. I ve made that driver for myself, for my
messageBody:
I'm afraid it doesn't work on a Mac, except perhaps if you use a Windows emulator - I don't know, I
have no Mac.
I've made that driver for myself, for my personal use, and I decided to share it with other
interested users of Windows.
I you have a Mac and you know how to do it, you could make a keyboard driver in XML or by using the
Keyboard Builder (http://www.versiontracker.com/dyn/moreinfo/macosx/20953). I can't try it now.

JF


----- Original Message -----
From: "mcbroom1946" <mcbroom1946@...>
To: <Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Sunday, November 21, 2004 4:36 PM
Subject: [Read_Alphabet] Re: How to use Jerome font?


>
>
> All this sounds interesting. But before I jump in, does this driver run on a
> Mac? Obviously, I have been disappointed before.
>
>
>
> --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "Jean-François Colson" <
> jfcolson@b...> wrote:
> >
> > Hi all
> >
> > Have you never considered making a Quickscript keyboard driver?
> > Some months ago I've made one with the program "Keyboard Layout
> Creator", but
> > - it was designed especially for my Belgian keyboard (an AZERTY
> keyboard), and
> > - I was sometimes compelled to type a space after a short vowel to get the
> text I want.
> >
> > Now I've bought a Keyman Developer licence and I've just made a
> mnemonic Quickscript keyboard
> > driver.
> > "Mnemonic" means that Keyman intercepts the text you type and convert it
> into the right Quickscript
> > characters.
> > Therefore the same driver can be used with any keyboard which allows you
> to type the Latin letters.
> > That driver is available at http://users.skynet.be/fa597525/Quickscript/.
> > It's quite easy to use if you remember that it is based on the IPA.
> > That's why I've chosen |j| for the letter Ye.
> > I use |y| for the letter Utter (remember the similarity between a tailless turned
> y and the IPA's
> > caret).
> > Long vowels and diphtongs are considered as vowel clusters.
> > I've used |x| as a modifier and |q| as a separator.
> >
> > Any comment or suggestion would be welcome.
> >
> > Jean-François Colson
> > jfcolson@b...
> >
> > PS: I've made that driver for the jerome font. For fonts with other encodings, I
> could adapt it
> > quite easily if needed. Simply mail me if you're interested.
>
>
>
>
>
>
